intro: Castilleja pallida var. communis, commonly known as the pale castilleja, is a hemiparasitic plant that belongs to the Orobanchaceae family. It is native to the western United States and grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. The plant has reduced leaves and relies on host plants for nutrients, forming a symbiotic relationship. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange and are clustered in dense inflorescences. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain insects.
